description.narrative: Outcome objective A: To increase awareness and knowledge of decision-makers and stakeholders on the conditions for PSP in the water sector at national and regional levels. Bridging Objective A.1 - National assessments on PSP in water infrastructure - Regional Report compiling the national cases Output objective A.2 - National assessments on PSP in water infrastructure - Regional Report compiling the national cases Outcome objective B: Enhanced intra-country coordination among actors involved in PSP. Bridging Objective B.1 Consultation meetings/workshops. Output objective B.2 - Elaboration of the national assessments through –among other tools- the use of consultation meetings/workshops Outcome objective C: To promote actively the extensive dissemination of sustainable policies that address the water governance-financing nexus. Bridging Objective C.1 Dialogue processes at regional levels, compilation of good practice. Output objective C.2 - Dialogue processes at national and regional levels - Identification and compilation of good cases - Technical/analytical work at large Outcome objective D: Improved enabling environment for PSP - Policy change at national level. Bridging Objective D.1 Dialogue and technical work. Output objective D.2 Conduct of technical work Outcome objective E: Identification and dissemination of good practices and sharing of experiences. Bridging Objective E.1 Reports from regional workshops, compilation of these experiences. Output objective E.2 - Documents/Reports from Regional Workshops - Compilation of the Regional Report Outcome objective F: Aid effectiveness Bridging Objective F.1 Donor dialogue needed. Output objective F.2 - Financing modalities of the work
Projektet håller på att formuleras men kommer att kopplas till den vattenstrategi som tagits from inom unionen för Medelhavet.
Proposal under development and it will be connected to the new regional water strategy under the Uuion for the Mediterranean.

sector.narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The final progress report presents output/outcomes from the sixth and final progress report-The organisation of a session on the investment potential in wastewater treatment andreuse in MENA, during the 2017 Stockholm Water Week, as part of the MENA Focusset of sessions, with direct linkages to the Project;-the advancement and finalisation of the national multi-stakeholder National PolicyDialogue in Lebanon with the organisation of the 2nd and 3rd consultation workshopsand the elaboration of the National Report on Lebanon on overcoming the governanceStällningstagande till rapportStatement on reportContribution challenges to private sector participation in water infrastructure;-the implementation of a second phase of work in the framework of the national multistakeholderPolicy Dialogue in Palestine with the organisation of targeted consultationworkshops organised and conducted under the leadership of the Palestinian WaterAuthority (PWA);-the co-organisation of the 3-day “Conference on Water Governance in MENA andwider Mediterranean region” (12-14 December 2017, Barcelona), together with the alsoSida-funded “Water Integrity Capacity Building Programme in MENA”. From theProject’s implementation perspective, the first and third day of the Conference representthe 3rd Regional Conference as envisaged in the Project Document;-the preparation of the Project’s Regional Report providing a regional perspective to thesystematic work done in the four focus countries; the regular update and wide use of thededicated project website hosted with the courtesy of GWP; the production of tailoredmade knowledge products and communication material;-further elaboration of the network on water governance and contribution to the OECDWater Governance Initiative (WGI);-further elaboration of the regional platform’s framework involving the network of policymakers and private actors, including linkages with the UfM Water Agenda and FinancialStrategy and future plans;- last but not least the strengthening of existing and the establishment of new operationalsynergies and strategic partnerships benefitting both the national and the regionalcomponents of the Project.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
